column5: That's just around the corner.lol.
That's a big corner,northern n k krumbs tonight john,thanks to KC landing.

Had walleye last and pan fries last night.Walleye just parchment paper bit of olive oil.No breading just seasoned a bit and then homemade wing sauce on them.Pretty good.pulling my blinds out today.Got snow coming and just way to windy.Then I'll be done and can go fishing.lol.
If that's the case,my wife makes egg rolls we can swap.
Sounds good.
Good news Eck.Shacks are going out on the ice today.Its still snowing and 40 km winds.Great day to be on lake.lol.
Sounds good,any day is a great day on a Ontario lake!
In a shack or pop-up yes.
Shacks are on the ice and above the honey holes.Let the games begin..Wayne said solid 12" of good ice.This is a great destination for some awesome fishing action.

Good to see Wayne enjoying some recreational activities. I only see him working when we’re at Northern Lights in May/June. 4 trips to that camp and I still haven’t met you. I appreciate your Cedar Lake reports though.
You own as much stuff as Wayne does,he has no choice but to work.
No doubt, and the primary reason it was nice to see a pic of him otherwise.
Thats amazing iam there a lot.lt me know when your there.ill come visit

Well I got out with Wayne at 3 today.We walked out to where the ice shacks normally would sit and Wayne cut 3 square holes with his battery powered chain saw.I grabbed a minnow and put it on my jig ,dropped it down and before Wayne cut third hole I had 2 eater walleyes up on the ice already.Talk about fast fishing.Ice looked to be around 8".First ice can be some of the best ice fishing of the season.We both limited out in 5 min.Fished till 3:30 and caught walleyes steady.Fun to get out on the ice for the first time today and couldn't of asked for nicer weather at oc/32f and some nice sunshine.Nothing like some fresh fish for supper.They do have cabin rentals and ice shacks are within a easy 100 yd walk or can drive right to shacks on the plowed road.Check them out for a ice fishing trip to KCs Landing or the more adventurous snowmobile trip to Anishinabi Lake Lodge.www.clarksresorts.com
Oh no!!!!!that can't be happening.
Oh no!!!!!that can’t be happening.[/QUOTE]LOL.Just checking the ice out Eck.Its getting thicker.Shacks will come out soon for you.Had to make sure we were on right spot.Apparantly we were.

LOL.Just checking the ice out Eck.Its getting thicker.Shacks will come out soon for you.Had to make sure we were on right spot.Apparantly we were.[/QUOTE] Yup you got'em dialed in,from ice water to hot oil.lol
Yup you got’em dialed in,from ice water to hot oil.lol[/QUOTE]Tomorrow they get hot oil treatment and maybe killer crumbs.

Good to see the quality fishing continues on Edward! I booked a trip to KC's this February and am quite looking forward to it. Any special jigs or jig colors work better there? I think I remember seeing you post about using hair jigs there in the past. Also, is there much of a night bite there? Gets dark pretty early in February.

Be fun to meet up.No special jigs required.1/16 Oz to 1/8 Oz all that is needed.I made up some light hair jigs last year and at times worked better than a minnow.1/16 Oz with a brownish/orange mix hair I got off some of my old muskie pike lures.They did work great.Ill be making some more as this last summer I used them from the boat and had some muskie/pike eat them.lol.

Enjoyed the fresh walleye from yesterday and my wife made a blueberry pie for dessert.Live is good in the Northwest.Weather +3c today and few more warm days coming.Got deer showing up in daytime so next week it's put some meat in the freezer.Sled deck in my truck and fired up sled today to in 4 pulls.Ready for the ice fishing season.
I gave the top 2 pictures a second look! LoL
You'll be eating that soon enough.Maybe get the wife to make a pie for you guys to.
